posts.post_content:
I was trying to decide if I wanted to play Golgari or Simic more in the likely event that all ten guilds are back. Then I saw this and suddenly Simic just seemed so much better.  
  
Course, that only matters if Golgari is back and still graveyard based, but that seems pretty reasonable to me.

posts.post_content: I always love seeing a classic get reprinted and this is no exception. Best of all, it avoids [Mental Misstep](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mental Misstep), which would otherwise stop any other form of graveyard hate ([Surgical Extraction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Surgical Extraction), [Nihil Spellbomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nihil Spellbomb), [Grafdigger's Cage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grafdigger's Cage), all of which cost one mana).

posts.post_content: I play a reanimator deck in Standard and of all the graveyard hate I came up against - [Dryad Militant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dryad Militant), [Groundseal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Groundseal), [Deathrite Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathrite Shaman), and [Grafdigger's Cage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grafdigger's Cage), this is the one I dread the most, but didn't see come up. Has few answers, can activate before removal happens, and costs nothing. Mind you, doesn't do anything else, which would probably explain why I didn't see it come up.
posts.html:
I play a reanimator deck in Standard and of all the graveyard hate I came up against - Dryad Militant, Groundseal, Deathrite Shaman, and Grafdigger's Cage, this is the one I dread the most, but didn't see come up. Has few answers, can activate before removal happens, and costs nothing. Mind you, doesn't do anything else, which would probably explain why I didn't see it come up.

Posted By: Equinox523 (2/13/2013 11:22:10 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ Bobth: I think that a card like this is good designed for at least a couple of reasons: it stops a very dangerous deck type, that is master of recursion and non-interactive gameplay, so a radical solution is good for keep those decks in check. It is very good agains graveyard, but it doesn't do anything else, so is not a card that you can play in main deck, or because it does always something interesting, like [Deathrite Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathrite Shaman)...   
  
I like to side in a couple of crypt and fetch them with [Tolaria West](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tolaria West)... Is the kind of move that makes me think that I planned my deck right!  
  
5/5 for being a classic that even almost 20 years later can still make the difference!
posts.html:
@ Bobth: I think that a card like this is good designed for at least a couple of reasons: it stops a very dangerous deck type, that is master of recursion and non-interactive gameplay, so a radical solution is good for keep those decks in check. It is very good agains graveyard, but it doesn't do anything else, so is not a card that you can play in main deck, or because it does always something interesting, like Deathrite Shaman...

I like to side in a couple of crypt and fetch them with Tolaria West... Is the kind of move that makes me think that I planned my deck right!

5/5 for being a classic that even almost 20 years later can still make the difference!

Posted By: leomistico (1/25/2013 10:54:46 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ Bobth:  
  
Incidental graveyard hate does exist, and it's played in every format. [Deathrite Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathrite Shaman) is very popular. Most other forms of incidental hate against the graveyard are weaker. In Modern, [Grafdigger's Cage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grafdigger's Cage) isn't even a great blanket answer due the popularity of [Living End](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Living End). End puts the creatures into play from exile and completely dances around Cage.
posts.html:

Posted By: DacenOctavio (1/21/2013 1:11:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'm not a big fan of cards that demolish a certain strategy, but do nothing on their own. I'd prefer something like a creature that taps to remove a card in a graveyard from the game. Maybe give it lifelink (or any random keyword) as well, with low P/T. Still something you'd want to keep in a sideboard, but not going to just win the game against graveyard users, and not totally useless against non-graveyard users.  
  
Edit: Let me clarify that... this card is insanely GOOD against graveyard strategies. I realize that. I just think it's bad design to have cards like that.
posts.html:
I'm not a big fan of cards that demolish a certain strategy, but do nothing on their own. I'd prefer something like a creature that taps to remove a card in a graveyard from the game. Maybe give it lifelink (or any random keyword) as well, with low P/T. Still something you'd want to keep in a sideboard, but not going to just win the game against graveyard users, and not totally useless against non-graveyard users.

Edit: Let me clarify that... this card is insanely GOOD against graveyard strategies. I realize that. I just think it's bad design to have cards like that.
